title.narrative: Addressing the protection needs of women and girls in South Sudan through an integrated protection response for female education and empowerment

description.narrative:
This project aims to address the catastrophic situation of women and girls in targeted locations of displacement and return through area-based life-saving protection engagements which, complemented by similarly targeted interventions in education and psychosocial, sexual and reproductive health services, and disability inclusion by UNICEF, UNFPA and IOM respectively, hold the potential to reverse the negative spiral of discrimination and violence which affects women and girls in many parts of South Sudan, through direct empowerment, as well as through the strengthening the protection and support systems in the communities of which they are part.
This CERF project significantly scales up the protection response for IDPs, returnees and vulnerable host communities, and addresses protection and lifesaving needs of women and girls in particular, while also creating an enabling environment for a sustainable response.
A total of 167,100 individuals in communities across the 11 prioritized counties are targeted by this project, including 98,800 women and girls targeted with specific protection engagements.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Addressing the protection needs of women and girls in South Sudan through an integrated protection response for female education and empowerment

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Establishment/strengthening of community-based networks and structures involving men, women, girls and boys
